> >When you right click on the file to run gladiator and then click on
> >properties, what special modifications have you done to make the game
> >run more smoothly?
> i haven't even looked at the settings :(
> >I have already closed down almost all my other programs
> >when running gladiator.
> so do i

I just use the settings I setup for a MS-DOS prompt, they don't modify
memory settings though, just disables a lot of the shortcut keys and the
screen saver.
I have a couple essential programs running in the background, the advice
programs give to "kill off everything not called explorer or systray" is
very very bad, if I did that I'd lose my firewall, mouse helper software
(and I'd have a 2 button mouse again...), virus scan shield (well it's
inactive, bloody thing repeatedly scans the same files while games are
running) and a couple of others that I won't mention.
I do believe the primary programs that screw up gaming are active virus
scanners, they kill performance by scanning all the files games load and
free dynamically - if your game keeps pausing this is the cause :)

Others shouldn't conflict really, and windows *should* allocate as much RAM
as possible in the various memory areas when you launch a DOS application,
but then nobody said windows memory management was good (or even half
decent).

and

You can disable the various shortcut keys, if you run glad.exe directly you
can right click on it, choose properties, and the bottom of the last tab has
a big pile of shortcut keys, including alt-enter, just disable it.

The ability to remap keys in the game would also be nice :)
